meanings.definition: A type of garment worn by certain clergy members.
meanings.sent1: The priest put on his white rochets before the church service.
meanings.sent2: The rochets of the bishop were beautifully embroidered with gold thread.
meanings.sent3: During the play, the actor mistakenly wore the rochets of the choir instead of his costume.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness and compassion were like a comforting rochets around the troubled souls.
meanings.sent5: The delicate lace on the rochets added an elegant touch to the church attire.

meanings.definition: The plural form of the word 'rochet'.
meanings.sent1: In the museum, there were displays of various rochets from different time periods.
meanings.sent2: The collection included rochets of different colors and designs.
meanings.sent3: The children were fascinated by the many rochets on display, imagining themselves as clergy members.
meanings.sent4: The rochets in the exhibit seemed to whisper stories of the past to those who gazed upon them.
meanings.sent5: The room was filled with the ethereal beauty of the delicate rochets.
